response.original_title: Keepers of the Faith:The Buddhist Nuns of the Sagaing Hills
response.overview: In the Sagaing Hills, 12 miles from the ancient capital of Mandalay are hundreds of pagodas, stupas, monasteries and nunneries which form a focal point of worship for Buddhism in Burma. In 1986 the filmmaker lived for 15 months as a nun in the Thameikdaw Gaung nunnery. Some years later she is coming back for a visit in order to see what has changed. This is an intimate insight into the daily life of a nunnery as well a portrait of the monastic economy and its interactions with the society.
response.title: Keepers of the Faith:The Buddhist Nuns of the Sagaing Hills
